Description:
Perfectly Positioned, Cottage With Character
Full of charm and sitting slightly elevated to the street, this delightful lace trimmed miner's cottage with pretty cottage garden has been beautifully uplifted to meet today's needs and comforts.
Keeping the original structure and nestled amongst other super cute cottages, this home lies within a 100 metre walk to the main street, to two primary schools and is opposite Apex Park.
This time-honoured cottage would be ideal for first home buyers or retirees.

Description:
SITTING ON TOP OF THE WORLD
This sensational lifestyle property is located on the top of Forest Hill. Just a short 15-minute drive to the spa centre of Daylesford or 25 minutes to Ballarat. This unique property boasts spectacular, uninterrupted views across the Seven Hills of Smeaton, the Wombat Hill at Daylesford, the Macedon Ranges and the Pyrenees Ranges. This property is being offered for sale for the first time in 150 years- in a very tightly held farming area. The 360-degree view is simply indescribable, you can see forever.
- 60 acres [approx.] with rich red volcanic soil
- Deep bore and road frontage on boundary
- Close to shops, schools and services
- 90 mins commuting distance to Melbourne
- Planning Permit to build has previously been issued but now expired
An inspection of this magnificent property is sure to impress. Please call for more details.

Description:
20 acres with powered shedding
This could be the site of your next country lifestyle home (STCA). Zoned Rural Living, this 20 acre powered property features excellent shedding previously used for wine making. 4x shipping containers are placed to provide a10m x10m undercover work area. The east container serving as a lab/kitchen, north container as an office and the south as storage all under one roofline. The roller door completes a secured area for an ideal all weather work space. Also additional 9m x 6m shed with concrete floor.
Water is provided by tank and power to 2 dams with ability to draw from 4 mega litre dam to smaller dam and 5 acres of defunct vines.
Peacock Track behind rear boundary allows for additional access point while natural bushland provides plenty of wildlife.
Only 10 mins to Maryborough, 10 mins to Clunes and 45 mins to Ballarat.
Wine making equipment available for purchase

Description:
How's the Serenity?
Set in the very quiet township of Allendale, merely minutes to Creswick and only 15 minutes to Daylesford sits an opportunity to secure a change in lifestyle. A picturesque and very private setting, this very neat country home on a 1-acre approx. allotment. Boasting established trees and gardens, with a large chicken coop and a vegetable garden to complete that country feel. The home consists of three bedrooms plus a study/office, very spacious living area and a separate dining room. The recently renovated kitchen incorporates a second dining area along with modern features, a main family bathroom and a separate laundry with direct outdoor access. Keeping you nice and toasty during the cooler winter months with two wood fire heaters along with spilt system heating & cooling to keep you just as comfortable during the height of summer. An undercover decked entertainment area is very private encouraging relaxation, perfect for your housewarming gathering. A generous workshop at the rear of the double carport adjoins the house along with an outdoor studio, three x 9,000 litre water tanks, 3.5 KW solar panels with a .66 cent buy-in would ensure those electricity bills are kept at a minimum. With loads of character and great presentation this property is perfect for those looking for that lifestyle change, if you endure the daily commute to the big smoke, just a little over an hour's drive will see you in Melbourne's CBD. A short drive to the Creswick or Ballarat train station if you prefer to park and ride to Southern Cross station. Lifestyle properties like these do not last, do not miss your opportunity to secure this idyllic property, Enquire today.

Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.

Description:
The Perfect Country Escape
CLOSING DATE SALE (unless sold prior)
Tuesday 23rd July at 4.00pm
Nestled on a spacious country block of over 3/4 of an acre(3481m2) is this quaint 2 bedroom cottage just 5 minutes drive to Creswick and only 25 minutes to both Ballarat and Daylesford.
Featuring an enclosed balcony/sunroom around 2 sides of the home and open plan living and dining with a central combustion wood heater and country kitchen with electric cooking and a central island service bench.
The main bedroom is spacious and light with sliding doors opening to the gardens and the second bedroom offers Built in robes.
This home would make an ideal weekender for those looking for a country escape close to all the Beauty of Hepburn but without the Daylesford price tag, and ideal first step on the property ladder or an ideal addition to an investors property portfolio with a currently rental appraisal of $240 a week.
A 2 bay lock up garage, along with extra shedding, external laundry, Bottled LP Gas, plenty of space for extra cars or heavy vehicles along with enough space to graze a pony. What more could you want?
The septic system system has just been updated to the latest guidelines along with an upgrade to the electricity wiring.
If youre wearing socks, prepare to have them blown clean off!
Insights: 4155 Creswick Newstead Road, Allendale VIC 3364 was last sold in 2019.

Description:
WILDLIFE AT YOUR DOORSTEP
A beautifully presented and private country homestead sited high on approx 3.62 hectares (8.95 acres) of lightly treed landscape and overlooking a large tranquil dam with its picturesque rotunda. The property is a haven for wildlife with kangaroos, wallabies, echidnas and birdlife right at your doorstep. The residence features bright and spacious living areas with views over the bushland, and offers comfortable low maintenance living year round. A huge lockup shed provides plenty of garaging, workshop and storage space while a studio near the residence provides opportunity for artistic pursuits.
Beautifully maintained brick home with wide verandahs all round and undercover entertaining area
Approx 3.62 hectare (8.95 acres) allotment in quiet residential court with good neighbours, lightly treed, beautiful bushland dam
3 bedrooms plus study/4th BR - master bedroom has split system airconditioning/heating, walk-in robe, ensuite bathroom
Spacious living-dining-kitchen area with large central kitchen that has plenty of bench and storage space plus butlers pantry
Family bathroom with bath and separate shower, separate toilet
Large separate laundry
8m x 15m steel shed with loft area, bathroom & laundry facilities, concrete floor, power, pot belly wood heater. Second garage and woodshed
Studio/cabin with power, wood heater
2 large rainwater tanks, new wood heater, mains power plus solar
Electric cooking, gas/solar hot water, ceiling fans, landline telephone, mobile coverage, NBN connected
Fenced orchard and raised garden beds
7 minutes from Daylesford, 20 minutes to Ballarat, school bus stop nearby

Description:
LIVING THE DREAM! GOLDFIELDS RESORT CRESWICK
Lifestyle seeker plus interesting options. Awaken in one magnificent setting, amongst interesting, upmarket neighbouring properties. Stroll to native bushland or high standard golf course within a swing. Enjoy a latte on the sidewalks in trendy Creswick, Daylesford or many of the historic gold towns within striking distance. Easy access to Western Freeway and/or rail to Melbourne from Ballarat (10 minutes).
*3 Bedrooms, *3 Bathrooms, *3 Living areas including theatre rooms, *4 toilets, *Well laid out kitchen, *Gas log + 2 split systems. The Design - allows the home to be locked off allowing living in the front half & accommodation at the rear which provides its own Kitchenette and private access and parking. Feel on full-time holidays while enjoying the magnificent cove

Description:
Start Out In Style
This classic period residence has recently undergone a breathtaking renovation, providing exceptional family appeal.
Exquisite Art Deco details including rich timber doors, dado panelling, picture rails and original fireplaces (fitted with gas log fire) along with new plaster, electrical wiring, a sunroom, fencing, ensuite & family bathroom, new carpet, floating floors, a creamy décor and an updated kitchen with quality appliances.
With walking distance to a bus stop & milk bar and 15 minutes through to Ballarat; this is sure to be a winner!

Description:
Wondrous Views & Resort Style Living At Golf Course Estate
What an amazing lifestyle that is on offer with this modern residence at the Gold Field Resort, Creswick. Just 10 minutes to Ballarat, 25 to Daylesford or a 5 minute stroll in to the hub of Creswick, you and your guests can enjoy pampering, coffee and rich history when not knocking the ball around the course. The home boasts three generous bedrooms, with the master having fantastic views over the first and ninth fairways and providing walk-in robe and ensuite. Downstairs the vast lounge is open plan to the dining and modern and highly functional kitchen. This area too looks over the golf course, BBQ area and tennis courts. The kitchen has all the expected mod-cons. You don't have to be a golfer to enjoy the estate as there are walking tracks, mountain bike tracks, animal & bird life and the "nineteenth hole" has restaurants and bar that overlook the estate, tree tops and hills beyond. Sounds beautiful doesn't it? Come inspect your future home, weekender or addition to your port-folio today.

Address: 1365 McCallum Creek Road Red Lion VIC 3371
Description:
As Bright As Morning Sunshine
Situated only a short 15-minute drive from the Maryborough shopping centre is this stunning rural property with breathtaking views across the surrounding country side.
The cosy home offers a generous master bedroom with built in robes, with remaining bedrooms of queen size proportions, formal lounge and light filled kitchen and dining.
The kitchen has a large picture window overlooking the undulating landscape.
For those cold winter nights the home an excellent enclosed wood fire and also has reverse cycle air conditioning for all year round comfort. The kitchen is well equipped with electric cook top & oven with ample bench and cupboard space.
There is an additional detached building in need of a few finishing touches which has power, plumbing and wood fire, ideal for those looking for a studio or additional guest accommodation or just the perfect place for the kids to play in a secure environment.
Situated on a generous 1 HA allotment this is a fabulous getaway close to both Talbot with its famous market and Maryborough.

Address: 1200 McCallums Creek Road Red Lion VIC 3371
Description:
Originally White Hart Hotel c1856
Transform this historic gem and make it your own country lifestyle escape. Set on approx. 39 acres, the potential of this property is limited only by your imagination.
Of 5 bedrooms, 2 were originally boarding rooms and one a Ladies Snug. With separate dining or second living, the configuration is very versatile. The country kitchen features a huge walk in pantry, lpg upright cooker and wood heating. Morning sun lights up the kitchen breakfast nook.
Solar feeds back into grid (current power bill in credit).
Plenty of shedding includes hay, shearing & wood sheds along with stable, huge workshop.
Mature shade trees are good protection for animal yards & dog runs.
Ample water supply with creek & tank water. Fertile creek flat runs through property with waterholes that store water year round. Wildlife abounds.
Zoned Rural Living, only 10 mins to Maryborough, 10 mins to Clunes and 40 minutes to Ballarat.
To arrange inspection please contact Jo Millar on 0438 081 301 or Angela Flowers on 0437 456 908

Description:
22 acres of pure peace & quiet
This fantastic property is ideal for the hobby farmer or just a great place to get away from the rat race. Located on the outskirts of Talbot, the gentle slope of the land ensures the dam gets plenty of water and takes full advantage of the lovely country views with the Pyrenees Ranges as a backdrop. Although mostly cleared, an area of mature Gum trees makes an ideal spot for a potential home site (STCA). Power pole on the property make for easy connection
Sheep yards & load race
School bus passes by end of road
A few minutes drive to the famous Talbot Farmers Market on the 3rd Sunday of the month
Zoned Rural Living
Only 10 minutes to Clunes & Maryborough & 40 minutes to Ballarat.

Description:
Affordable lifestyle living set on 20 cleared acres

The property has plenty of sundry shedding , 2 dams with pump and approx. 44,000 L tank water.
Set in the appealing locale of Evansford approx. 35 min to Ballarat, 20 min to Clunes and Maryborough and only 10 min to the popular Talbot farmers market, this property will tick many boxes.
Chasing a lifestyle dream?
Then an inspection is highly recommended.

Description:
OLD NEWLYN BUTCHERS SHOP AND RESIDENCE c1860
Offered for the first time in 25 years is this enchanting old Newlyn Butchers shop and residence. Located in the picturesque Newlyn Township 18 kms from Daylesford and only 26 kms from the Ballarat CBD. Here is a unique opportunity to own a historically significant property with intact period features in a highly sought-after position.
The original 4 room cottage was built c1860 by a Cornish miner and around 1903 a weatherboard butcher shop was added to the front. Later a much larger house was moved to the site from Ballarat to creating a single dwelling. The butchers shop operated until early 1980s.
The property has for many, many years been successfully been part of the Newlyn Antique and Cottage Garden Nursery and is available for the next phase and a new occupant. It is suited for a diverse range of uses including a gallery, exhibition space, function centre, restaurant, café or as permanent residence or weekender.
Large 2666m2 approx. site [ 0.7 Acre]
Wide timber floor boards
New large garage and sundry shedding
High ceilings with Period details
271 m2 [approx.] building area plus shed and outbuilding
Town water, electricity and 25 panel solar installation

Description:
2 homes, 1 title, room for 1 more? Fantastic location
A quiet peaceful area ideal for investment or to live in one, and supplement your income. 2 lovely 1 bedroom properties located on the one 965sqm title, with potential (stca) for another dwelling perhaps. Beautiful easy care and private garden to the front home, generously sized bedroom with BIR, large living area with scope for guest room, double garage, solar panels, security shutters and water tank. Quality plantings including fruit trees. The original brick veneer home at the rear provides similar accommodation with slightly larger living space, a verandah across the front and single carport and is currently let at $140pw. Ideally located with easy access to town centre and a lovely rural aspect.

Description:
LINDISFARNE - A Warm Family Home in Picturesque Locale
This charming 3-bedroom home has been lovingly maintained with nothing to do except move in. Set on approximately 3 acres of fully fenced paddocks with immaculate gardens and your very own orchard with an array of fruit trees including quinces, apples and plums to name a few. This beautiful home offers a functional kitchen with 900mm stainless steel freestanding gas cooker, large corner pantry and ample bench space. Seamlessly connecting is the central open living and dining area, with gorgeous stain glass windows, offering an abundance of natural light, keeping you warm on these cools nights with the enviable wood heater, along with the convenience of a split system and ceiling fan for the warmer months. The home offers three queen sized bedrooms, including the master with a large walk in robe and full ensuite comprising corner bath with shower, toilet and functional vanity. Further features to this glorious package include the family bathroom offering a large corner vanity, shower and toilet, fantastic storage throughout, and beautiful period features of stain glass windows. Externally, the home offers a great undercover entertaining area and shedding/workshop. Words don't do this property justice, so please book your inspection today to fully appreciate the charming character of this beauty!

Description:
Thinking of a Tree Change? 7.2 Acre Bush Block with Current Planning Permit
Combining a tranquil bush setting with the convenience of easy access to the Midland Highway, this three-hectare bush block is ready for your Escape to the country' dream home.
Serviced by formed gravel roads to the North & South, this triangular block overlooks the fertile basalt farmlands sweeping from Springmount to the Northeast & to Clarkes Hill & Dean in the Southeast. High speed internet broadband is available.
This former farmland, now covered with a rapidly regenerating Central Highlands forest offers wildflowers, wildlife habitat, a sustainable firewood supply and even sufficient timber for a house & outbuildings.
There is a small dam and an enormous drawcard for fossickers with the 1100 hectare Regional Park adjoining. This park also adds potential for B&B accommodation (STCA), especially as the Ballarat to Bendigo Goldfields walking, cycling & horse riding trails passes by.
A huge advantage to this private sanctuary is the approved planning permit for a four bedroom home with construction to start before April 2021 (plans available); making the hurdle for building one step closer.
With perfect base for a home's foundation & driveway along with more fertile soil for a vineyard or garden, this property promises to offer premium lifestyle opportunities, just 6kms from the beautiful Creswick township.

Build Your Dream Home Here!
Situated in an ideal location, just metres from the Cafes and Restaurants of Albert St and with commanding views over Creswick Creek and Hammond Park is this 1272m2(approx) lifestyle block with all services available.
Build your dream home or capitalize on the fantastic tourism potential (air BnB)with the incoming International Mountain Bike Track close by.
With true family sized blocks of land becoming a rarity in Creswick, this is a golden opportunity to make your mark and secure your future. Contact Agent for further information.

Description:
COUPLES DELIGHT IN POPULAR TALBOT
This cozy home is set on 4413m2 (approx.) of land and boasts impressive rural views of Talbot. This beautiful one bedroom home has recently been fully renovated and is sure to impress.
Enjoy a fresh modern kitchen with granite bench tops, generous storage & 2pac gloss finish. The stylish kitchen also comes fitted with brand new appliances. The open plan living room features a wood heater and split system catering to all your cooling and heating needs. The stunning new bathroom comes with a large bath and separate over-sized shower overlooking rural views. A new generously sized laundry and study/sleep out area completes the interior of this home. In addition, a fully powered 6 x 9m double garage allows plenty of room for a workshop and storage. This large allotment allows for future development (STCA), home extension or perhaps a small hobby farm. Inspection is a must, so call today!

Description:
Dream Locale To Build Your Dream Home
This attractive allotment is found at the prestigious RACV Resort Creswick. The parcel is approx. 503m2 in size with a fabulous frontage of 21 meters that will easily hold a larger dwelling. Any home constructed would grant amazing views over the course, with greens, bunkers, fairways and dams all within chipping distance. There are beautiful gum trees, walking & mountain bike tracks to enjoy, kangaroos and birdlife as well. The block is the shortest of strolls to the 19th hole to take advantage of the bar and restaurant. The Resort is 2 minutes to the hub of town, 10 minutes to Ballarat and 25 minutes to Daylesford. With Melbourne just an hour away, any home built could also be the perfect weekender. Investors should note the township has the lowest possible rental vacancy percentage. If you think your family deserves the loveliest of lifestyles, you should consider this allotment.
* This information has been prepared to assist solely in the marketing of this property. While all care has been taken to ensure the information provided herein is correct, we do not take responsibility for any inaccuracies. Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.
